name: Shindig
description:
Not all heroes wear capes – sometimes folk just need a helping hand. In Shindig, YOU can be a low-key hero, by organising a party to cheer up the glum populace of your new neighbourhood.

In this optimistic, fully-voiced narrative adventure, help out a rainbow of quirky characters with their troubles, gather all the bits for a brilliant bash, and bring the community together for a joyous party. You've got this!

Features:


  • Explore a hand-drawn, picturebook setting, accompanied by an original soundtrack stacked with bops, and full English voiceover!
  • Enjoy a short narrative adventure presented in a point-and-click style. Shindig takes just a few hours to play - about the length of a feature film
  • Choose your look from a range of skin tones and hairstyles, and select between a masculine(ish) and feminine(ish) player character voice. (We're just two devs. It's literally us.)
  • Chill with cosy, low-stakes gameplay, and some light puzzle-solving
  • Meet a diverse cast of characters who want to talk about their big boggles
  • Chortle at idiosyncratic humour throughout – with a couple of silly songs, and a side-helping of real talk
  • Tweak your settings with independent controls for SFX, voice and music volumes, and a Closed Captions overlay option that calls out many nonverbal sounds for our HoH players
  • While it’s not designed FOR kids (we use a few big words) Shindig has no swears or scares, just a few serious conversations in the hangouts touching on a variety of deeper emotional topics – if that’s not your bag, much of the serious stuff is in optional hangouts that you can ignore if you want to
  • Embark on a little, linear adventure with zero choice pressure and only one ending – the GOOD ENDING!
